PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Arise:Arise provides remote customer service opportunities where you can work as an independent contractor.7. Clickworker:Clickworker offers microtasks with customizable scheduling. Pay ranges from $20 to $25/hour.9. Preply:Preply is an online tutoring platform offering opportunities in over 100 subjects. Set your own rates, with potential earnings exceeding $40/hour.10. Transcription Hub:Transcription Hub provides flexible transcription jobs, allowing you to choose your own schedule.11. PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Arise:Arise provides remote customer service opportunities where you can work as an independent contractor.7. Clickworker:Clickworker offers microtasks with customizable scheduling. Pay ranges from $20 to $25/hour.9. Preply:Preply is an online tutoring platform offering opportunities in over 100 subjects. Set your own rates, with potential earnings exceeding $40/hour.10. Transcription Hub:Transcription Hub provides flexible transcription jobs, allowing you to choose your own schedule.11. PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Pay ranges from $20 to $25/hour.9. Preply:Preply is an online tutoring platform offering opportunities in over 100 subjects. Set your own rates, with potential earnings exceeding $40/hour.10. PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Arise:Arise provides remote customer service opportunities where you can work as an independent contractor.7. Clickworker:Clickworker offers microtasks with customizable scheduling. Pay ranges from $20 to $25/hour.9. Preply:Preply is an online tutoring platform offering opportunities in over 100 subjects. Set your own rates, with potential earnings exceeding $40/hour.10. Transcription Hub:Transcription Hub provides flexible transcription jobs, allowing you to choose your own schedule.11. PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY â€“ VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:â€¢ A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, andâ€¢ At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:â€¢ Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.â€¢ Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment â€” provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)â€¢ Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineeringâ€¢ Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:â€¢ 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, andâ€¢ 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

ğŸ” Equality in C#: == vs Equals()Hey folks!Iâ€™ve run into subtle bugs in my code more than once, only to discover the root cause was how I was comparing objects. In C#, == and Equals() seem to do the same thingâ€”until they surprise you with unexpected behavior.Hereâ€™s my personal cheat sheet on the key differencesâ€”no fluff, just clarity to help you write cleaner, less error-prone code.ğŸ”¹ The == OperatorCompile-time binding â†’ Decided by the compilerReference types â†’ Checks if both variables point to the same objectValue types â†’ Compares the actual values; for custom structs, youâ€™ll need to overload itNull-safe â†’ null == null is true, null == non-null is falseğŸ”¹ The Equals() MethodRuntime binding â†’ Supports overrides and polymorphismReference types â†’ Default compares references, but can be overridden for content comparisonValue types â†’ Uses reflection to compare fields (not very performantâ€”consider overriding)Null handling â†’ a.Equals(b) throws if a is null â†’ prefer object.Equals(a, b) for safetyğŸ“– A Real-Life AnalogyImagine two copies of The Great Gatsby:==: â€œAre these the exact same physical book?â€Equals(): â€œDo these books contain the same text?â€ğŸ“ Quick Code Sampleclass Book { public string Title; public override bool Equals(object obj) => obj is Book b && Title == b.Title; public static bool operator ==(Book a, Book b) => object.Equals(a, b); public static bool operator !=(Book a, Book b) => !object.Equals(a, b); public override int GetHashCode() => Title?.GetHashCode() ?? 0;}ğŸš¦ When to Use Which?Pro tip: If you override Equals(), always override GetHashCode() too. Itâ€™s essential for correct behavior in dictionaries and hash-based collections.ğŸ‘‡ Whatâ€™s the trickiest equality bug youâ€™ve solved in C#?
